Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: TEST EQUIPMENT: This reference table describes specific types of equipment usedfor well testing. For example casing packer, hook wall packer or straddle packer.
Column Comment.6: EQUIPMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Observation number defining theuniqueness for each occurrence of equipment used.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the specific piece of equipment thatwas used in the test.
Column Comment.10: EQUIPMENT LENGTH: Equipment length is the measured length of the equipment.
Column Comment.11: EQUIPMENT LENGTH OUOM: String equipment length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.12: EQUIPMENT WEIGHT: Equipment weight is the mass of the string equipment.
Column Comment.13: EQUIPMENT WEIGHT OUOM: Equipment weight original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.15: INSIDE DIAMETER: The inside diameter of the string equipment.
Column Comment.16: INSIDE DIAMETER OUOM: Inside diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: OUTSIDE DIAMETER: The diameter of the specific tool used during the formationtest.
Column Comment.18: OUTSIDE DIAMETER OUOM: Outside diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the equipment.
Column Comment.22: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
